creator: intel2@naver.com
text:
Created attachment 34960 result in excel and MS Internal Format List Hi. I used poi library(ver 3.12) to create xls file. And I've found a bug. I noticed that when a xls file is created using POI, the default style for the button "Comma Style" results in the format which includes the currency symbol("$"). Checking the source(in file BuiltinFormats.java), where internal formats are defined, I found the following, putFormat(m, 0x29, "_(\"$\"* #,##0_);_(\"$\"* (#,##0);_(\"$\"* \"-\"_);_(@_)"); putFormat(m, 0x2a, "_(* #,##0_);_(* (#,##0);_(* \"-\"_);_(@_)"); But in excel's internal format list, two entries are 0x29 _(* #,##0_);_(* (#,##0);_(* "-"_);_(@_) 0x2a _($* #,##0_);_($*(#,##0);_($* "-"_);_(@_) Even in comments of BuiltinFormats.java, there are * 0x29, "_(* #,##0_);_(* (#,##0);_(* \"-\"_);_(@_)"
* 0x2a, "_($* #,##0_);_($* (#,##0);_($* \"-\"_);_(@_)"
So you have to fix this part. * ps : It is same in 3.16.

creator: tallison@mitre.org
text: Thank you for raising this.  Will fix shortly.

r1792918


Thank you, again, for raising this.  Let us know if you find anything else.
creator: tallison@mitre.org
